summary: An internal email from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan dated August 14, 2019, detailing Critical Incident Stress Team (CST) activations and supervisory wellness checks on two staff members placed on administrative leave following the death of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The document shows institutional procedures in the immediate aftermath of the incident.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC New York who was placed on administrative leave and was the subject of repeated, unsuccessful wellness checks by the Critical Incident Stress Team following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC New York who was placed on administrative leave and was successfully contacted and visited for a wellness check by the Critical Incident Stress Team following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers at MCC New York placed on administrative leave and subject to wellness checks following the same critical incident.

events.title: CST Activation and Initial Wellness Checks
events.description: The Critical Incident Stress Team (CST) was activated at 10:30 a.m. following Jeffrey Epstein's death. Attempts to contact Officers Noel and Thomas were unsuccessful; their well-being was confirmed through other staff.

events.title: Continued Unsuccessful Wellness Checks
events.description: Further attempts to conduct wellness checks on Officers Noel and Thomas were unsuccessful; both were reported as not ready for visits.

events.title: Successful Contact and Visit with Officer Thomas
events.description: A supervisor made phone contact and then met with Officer Thomas at his residence at approximately 3:30 p.m. for a wellness check.

events.title: Final CST Activation and Walk-and-Talk
events.description: CST was activated at 6:00 a.m. to conduct walk-and-talk sessions with staff on all shifts. Attempts to connect with Officer Noel were still ongoing.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center Manhattan, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The Critical Incident Stress Team (CST) was activated on Saturday, August 10, 2019, at 10:30 a.m., which was the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
Two correctional officers, Noel and Thomas, were placed on administrative leave and were the subjects of repeated supervisory wellness checks following the incident.
Initial attempts to contact the officers directly were unsuccessful; their well-being was initially confirmed through communication with other staff members close to them.

A supervisor successfully met with Officer Thomas at his residence on Monday, August 12, 2019, for a wellness check, but attempts to connect with Officer Noel were still ongoing as of Wednesday, August 14.
The document is an internal email demonstrating the Bureau of Prisons' institutional response and duty of care procedures for staff following a critical incident.
